revised_title: Foam-Structure and Transition from Liquid to Solid State in Matter
tldr: The author investigates the transition from the liquid to the solid state and the foam-structure of various substances, including water, benzene, and metals. They observe that solid bodies exhibit a foam-structure with walls and contents that contract differently during the solidification process. This research provides insights into the similarities between the freezing of water and other liquids, as well as the structure of metals and their surface properties.
